alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 5:19PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...MICROBURST WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN RIO ARRIBA AND NORTHERN SAN JUAN COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 518 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong microburst winds along a line extending from Ojo Amarillo to 11 miles northwest of Heron Lake State Park. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Kirtland, Bloomfield, Aztec, Shiprock, Chama, Dulce, Tierra Amarilla, Navajo Dam and Upper Fruitland. This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 139 and 174. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 1 and 183. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Blowing dust associated with strong microburst winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: Far Northwest Highlands; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
